item.title: September 13, 2012 Meeting Minutes
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
DAORN MEETING MINUTES   Date: September 13, 2012                                                  HOST FACILITY:  Children’s   Meeting called to order by Rebecca Loptien at 1805   Thank you to sponsors: Rebecca Loptien, DAORN President acknowledged Children’s Hospital for hosting the meeting and Stryker for providing the dinner.   Attendance/Guests:  There were 34 members present and 7 guests introduced.   Approval of May meeting minutes- minutes approved as written.   Treasurer’s report:  **see balance sheet   General Fund:                                  $ 20,448.39 Raffle Fund:                                      $      612.70 Bill Lord Scholarship Fund:           $   3,391.75 Subtotal Current Assets:   $24,452.84 King Soopers:                                  $   3,250 Total Current Assets:       $27,702.84   Correspondence: R. Loptien – Two thank you cards from Bill Lord scholarship recipients.  There will be a private viewing on Weds.12/12/12 for the Rose Bowl Float if interested.  Rebecca received the report from national board of directors dated 8-17 & 8-18-12.  Chapter received congratulations card from Carlyne White – past President 1974-1975 with either $50 or $100 donation.   Board Report:  None   Old business:
  • Directory – Publicity committee will publish about 25 directories for distribution so please make sure your contact information is up-to-date.
    • Clarification of Bill Lord Scholarship criteria - Rebecca relayed concerns on lack of clarity in the decision to allocate funds “50/50” to the scholarship and general fund; and that it may appear deceiving to advertise the golf tournament as benefitting nursing scholarships when 50% of proceeds get allocated to general fund.  Members discussed most of the general funds go for delegates to attend Congress which is related to nursing education.  Rebecca researched bylaws which state the board can allocate the % proceeds annually. Board will discuss at next meeting if Ellen Lord can be present to provide input.
    • Committee sign up – We still have vacancies so please let the chairs or Rebecca know if you are willing to volunteer.
       New business:
  • Networking with members – Changed from January meeting to April meeting due to Victoria Steeleman (national officer) providing CEU at January meeting.
  • Congress Silent Auction – This will be the 60th Congress and DAORN board would like to participate but need ideas.  Member suggested donating a trip to the leadership conference which is in Colorado annually.  Julie Mower agreed to check into registration cost and Melanie will help with hotel contacts.
  • Foundation and Chapter Challenge donation – Last year we donated $500 which helps support nursing scholarships.  Motion was made to donate $500 this year.  Discussion was heard regarding limiting to $500 again this year and donating more funds to Bill Lord scholarship.  Mary Jo Steiert made a motion to amend previous motion to increase foundation donation to $1,000 (based on chapter having healthy balance).  Motion was approved with only 3 opposed.
    Committee Reports                 (Committee chairs or designees)
  • Nominating:  chapter approved for 16 delegates.
  • By Laws:  Updated books were distributed and Barb was thanked for her contributions as Amanda will be new committee chair.
  • Awards – no report
  • Fall workshop, Education: Fall Workshop will be Oct. 19th at PSL.  See Peggy for volunteer sign up and Save the Date cards. Please complete evaluations for CEU offering tonight.
  • Finance – no report
  • Legislative: no report
  • Membership – no report
  • Publicity – won’t be sending post cards this year so check annual mailer that was recently sent or the website for future meeting dates.  Members can sign up for email notifications on DAORN website, but email changes must go through AORN headquarters.
  • OR Nurse Week – Annual museum event was described and will be Nov. 10th from 10-3pm.  Volunteer sigh up sheet distributed and request to gather supplies was made by committee chair.
  • Education Grants – There is no deadline to applying for grants.
  • Ways and Means – Congress sales generated profit of $500-$600 which poses the question of do we want to continue since it is so much work?  No decision made.  Update of golf tournament profit of $2,251.70.  Silent auction sold 7 Peyton Manning prints but “lightly reprimanded” with warning for “wall of wine” sale which it is illegal to raffle alcohol (who knew?!!).  Chair also posed question of changing golf tournament to fall which Peggy will survey vendors and report back in November.  Subsequent discussion regarding allocation of funds from golf tournament which was deferred until October board meeting when Ellen Lord can provide input.
  • Research – Still need chair.
  • Hospital Captains – Please see Cathy A. to update list.
  • Raffle/Historian - Gerry thanked everyone who participated in silent auction.
  • Informatics – already reported under publicity (see above).
  • Teller committee – no report
    Meeting adjourned at 1902   Respectfully submitted, Julie Martin, Secretary

item.title: President's message October 2012
item.dc:creator: President
item.content:encoded:
An update for all of our members on some activity I am working on as your president. Some of you have already received an e-mail from me in an effort to reach all of our 456 members. I am almost half way through the list and have had a few responses. The next step will be to do a survey to also reach out to all of our members. I believe we can do some things different to increase involvement. Julie Mower, your president elect, and I are committed to doing this. We know it will be an effort than spans more than one year so I will continue to work with Julie as past president. If any of you are interested in working with us please let me know.
I know it is just approaching November but it is already time to think about who will run for office in the spring. Please consider serving the chapter in 2013-2014. The nominating committee will be in touch with you but it is so nice when volunteer.
I am also working on obtaining a conference call number that we can use every month so you will always have the number when you cannot attend in person. Watch for this to be posted before the next meeting.
We held our joint workshop October 19 and we feel it was quite successful; especially considering our problem in securing a location. We had 30 Healthcare representatives and 66 attendees.
Our next event is to educate the public about our important role as perioperative nurses. This will be held November 10th at the Museum of Nature and Science. I feel this is one of the really fun things we do as a chapter is a great way to serve.
it is a pleasure working with the Denver chapter and I look forward to seeing many of you at our next meeting.
Becky Loptien
DAORN president

item.title: DAORN Officer Nominations
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded: Dear DAORN Member: The Nominating Committee is taking nominations effective immediately for officers and committee positions.  This year, all nominations will be accepted through e-mail either to the Nominating Committee members (see below) or to the DAORN website.  You may and are encouraged to nominate another eligible member for office or volunteer by nominating yourself. If you would like to run for office, or if you would like to nominate someone for office, please do so by February 8, 2013.  Nominations can be submitted to April Erbland at aerbland@comcast.net or to Amanda Brown at cnsbrown@gmail.com.  Nominations may also be submitted to the DAORN website via the Contact Us link. When submitting a nomination, please include a short biography (maximum 6 lines of text) for the candidate being nominated.  Biographies for all nominees will be included with the mailed ballot.  All nominated and self-nominated candidates must fill out a Willingness to Serve form to accept the nomination.  The Willingness to Serve form can be found on the DAORN website. You will receive a ballot with instructions on how to vote at the end of February/beginning of March. The following positions are open for candidate nominations: President-elect The President-elect observes, assists and consults with the President in preparation for assuming the duties and responsibilities of the office.  This person facilitates continuity in transition to the office of president. President-elect is elected each year and serves in that capacity for one (1) year, and then automatically becomes President for a term of one (1) year. Eligibility for Nomination:  To be eligible for the office of President-elect, a nominee must have served at least one (1) year as a member of the Board of Directors. Treasurer The Treasurer monitors the fiscal affairs of the Association and provides reports and interpretation to the membership and the Board of Directors. The Treasurer shall be elected in the odd numbered years for a term of two (2) years and shall serve until a successor has assumed office. Board of Directors Member (1 open position) The Board of Directors consists of the officers and three (3) elected members. It has power, authority and responsibility to manage the affairs of the Association, except to modify action of the members. One (1) member of the Board of Directors shall be elected in odd numbered years for a term of (2) years and shall serve until a successor has assumed office. Regular meetings of the Board shall be at least four (4) per year.  Special meetings of the Board of Directors may be called by the President or by and two (2)  members of the Board upon request  to the President. Eligibility for nomination:  To be eligible for elective office as a member of the Board of Directors, or a member of the Nominating Committee, a nominee must have been a member of the Association continuously for two (2) years immediately prior to being nominated. Nominating Committee Member (2 open positions) The Nominating and Leadership Development Committee consists of five (5) members. Two (2) members are selected in the odd years for a term of two (2) years. The Nominating Committee prepares and presents a slate of candidates to serve for all elected positions.  They prepare and present a list of eligible nominees for election of delegates to the National AORN Congress.  Nominations for elected officers may be made from the floor at the time the slate is presented, provided that eligibility has been verified and written consent to serve if elected was obtained from the nominee, and is submitted at the same time of the nomination. The Committee selects a chair from the continuing committee members. Eligibility for nomination:  To be eligible for elective membership of the Nominating Committee, a nominee must have had active membership in this (local) Association for two (2) years prior to nomination. The members of the Nominating and Leadership Development Committee may not be listed as candidates for election on a slate they have prepared. Please see above for Board of Directors and Nominating Committee eligibility. Overall Eligibility:  To be eligible for elective office as an office, or the Board of Directors, or as a member of the Nominating Committee and Leadership Development Committee a nominee must currently provide or have previously provided perioperative nursing care that addresses(ed) the needs of patients preoperatively, intraoperatively and postoperatively. We look forward to hearing from you and involving you in the process of selecting our new officers. Kindly, DAORN Nominating Committee

item.title: 16th Annual Perioperative Services Workshop
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
Perioperative Services invites you to attend the

16th Annual Perioperative Services Workshop

Saturday, February 23, 2013

7:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.

Children’s Hospital Colorado

Mount Oxford Auditorium

Perioperative Workshop Flyer 2-23-2013

     

 

Overview and Target Audience

This activity is for perioperative nursing and sterile processing staff, and will provide updates in the management of various pediatric surgical diagnoses that will enhance their knowledge and skill.
 

Objectives

At the conclusion of this program, participants should be able to:
  • Describe two approaches to dealing with pre-operative anxiety in children.
  • Describe three specific nursing considerations, when caring for patients who will be having a pediatric urological procedure.
  • Identify two national health care issues that could have affects on our state or hospital policies in the next year.
  • Describe two lessons learned from caring for children in a third world perioperative environment.
Children’s Hospital Colorado is an approved provider of continuing nursing education by the Colorado Nurses Association, an accredited approver by the American Nurses Credentialing Center’s Commission on Accreditation.
 
This educational activity for 4.25 nursing contact hours is provided by Children’s Hospital Colorado.  A certificate of attendance will be available at the end of the presentation upon return of the completed evaluation.
 
A general certificate of attendance will be given to all other care providers.
 
Registration and Contact Information
There is a registration fee of $10.00.  Registration is required by February 15, 2012.  Confirmations will not be sent. For questions please contact Anne Wolters at anne.wolters@childrenscolorado.org or 720-777-6122.  Terry Lee, BSN RN CPN can also be contacted for questions at terry.lee@childrenscolorado.org or 720-777-8241.

Voting is now open for AORN elected positions. Every member can vote, not just delegates going to Congress. This is your chance to select the leaders who will chart the future of AORN. Please vote early!
It only takes 3-5 minutes and is done online
  1. Go to www.aorn.org (your user name is your email address)
  2. Log in
    • Write down your member number located in “my account” (or click on the tab “my AORN” and it will appear)
  3. Follow the link to the voting page

DAORN MEETING MINUTES   Date: April 11, 2013                                                  HOST FACILITY:  No. Suburban   Meeting called to order by Rebecca Loptien at 1808   Thank you to sponsors: Rebecca Loptien, DAORN President acknowledged Chad from Ansel sponsored dinner and North Suburban Hospital for hosting the meeting.   Attendance/Guests:  There were 38 members present and 3 guests introduced.   Approval of January 2013 meeting minutes- minutes approved as written.   Treasurer’s report:  **see balance sheet   General Fund:                                  $ 17,688.54 Raffle Fund:                                      $      104.70 Bill Lord Scholarship Fund:           $   3,391.75 Subtotal Current Assets:   $21,184.99 King Soopers:                                       2,475 Total Current Assets:       $23,659.99   Correspondence: Centennial chapter 0606 (Loveland) disbanded – 59 members transferred into DAORN.   Board Report:  AORN Leadership conference on July 19 and DAORN usually hosts dinner groups. If interested contact Deb Warren at headquarters or Julie Mower.  Nurse’s week is first week in May and International coffee is bringing coffee carts into hospitals.  Julie will send flyers to hospital captains and ask Faith to put on website. 2013 past congress delegates are obligated to help with either fall workshop and/or golf tournament as committee members.   Old business:
  • Congress report on 60th annual conference- Rose gave an update including shortening Congress next year by 1 day (saves approx. $200,00); bylaws hearing discussed nomination by petition; periop. efficiency tool kit released; new release of Nurse Link next month; silent auction raised $49K; and named new national officers.  Position statements will now be voted on by members (house of delegates).
   New business:
  • Election results for year 2013-2014: President Elect: Sharon Luhrs; Treasurer: Tammy Woolley; Board of Directors:  Kathy Dougherty; Nominating Committee:  Peggy Camp and Jim Stobinski.  Motion made and approved to destroy ballots.
            Committee Reports  (Committee chairs or designees)
  • Nominating: New officers mentioned above under new business.
  • By Laws: All of the proposed national bylaw changes were passed.  Amanda has transferred bylaw manuals to discs.
  • Awards – National Award for Excellence deadline is August 30, Chapter awards Nov. 1, 2013, and individual awards Sept. 30, 2013.
  • Fall workshop, Education: Fall Workshop is Nov. 22 at PSL; Peggy has several potential speakers interested with nursing topics. Foundation has funds available if you have several people wanting to view some of the Congress presentations online (application through headquarters).  IMS contacted Peggy regarding a half day Saturday program in June or July (mostly SPD topics). New chapter in Vail having education offering Sat. May 4th ($45 for AORN members for 6 CEUs).
  • Finance – No report (see above).
  • Legislative - No report (see above).
  • Membership –No report.
  • Publicity – No report.
  • OR Nurse Week – No report.
  • Education Grants – No report.
  • Ways and Means – Congress booth in 2013 raised approximately $1,200.   June 3rd golf tournament and brochure is on the DAORN website. Hospital captains requested to print brochures and hand out to local vendors.  Delegates responsible to volunteer at both events and/or donate an item for the silent auction.
  • Research – No report.
  • Hospital Captains – No report.
  • Raffle/Historian – Several items donated tonight.
  • Informatics – No report.
  • Teller committee – No report.
  Meeting adjourned at 1858   Respectfully submitted, Julie Martin, Secretary

We also need cash donations of $10 or more to buy bottle water and snacks for the Golfers" Courtesy Bags.

DAORN MEETING MINUTES   Date: May 9, 2013                                                  HOST FACILITY:  St. Anthony’s   Meeting called to order by Rebecca Loptien at 1800   Thank you to sponsors: Rebecca Loptien, DAORN President acknowledged Cathy Andrews and St. Anthony’s Hospital for hosting the meeting.   Attendance/Guests:  There were 29 members present and 2 guests introduced.   Approval of April 2013 meeting minutes- minutes approved as written.   Treasurer’s report:  **see balance sheet   General Fund:                                  $ 14,847.13 Raffle Fund:                                      $      103.70 Bill Lord Scholarship Fund:           $   4,891.75 Subtotal Current Assets:   $  19,842.58 King Soopers:                                  $    5,875.00 Total Current Assets:       $  25,717.58   Correspondence: None   Board Report:  Board awarded one scholarship for the Bill Lord applicants to Julie Jackson at the amount of $1,000.   Old business:

Please sign up to golf if interested (there are three available spots with vendors as well).  Donations to silent auction being given to Gerry.  Members can donate wrapped protein bars, etc. for the give- away bags by June 2nd.

item.title: July 2013 - DAORN President's Message
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded: Hello all and happy pre-4th of July, Your DAORN board and committee chairs have already been hard at work to prepare for an exciting 2013-2014 season (sort of like the Rockies, but with much better pitching). The combined board meeting was hosted by CCI June 24th. There are some great changes in store for members, but you’ll have to come to the Sept. meeting at AORN headquarters to find out what they are, and how you can contribute. The new board members would like to take this opportunity to begin introducing themselves to you. Highlighted this week is one of our board members, Kathy Doughty, and our new treasurer, Tammy Woolley. Even if you know these folks already, I’ll bet you learn something new about them after reading their bios slides (attached). Other board members will be highlighted in future e-mailings. The Fall workshop committee met at Peggy Camp’s house last night. This workshop looks to be one of our best ever with an exciting slate of nationally recognized speakers and timely topics to enhance our perioperative practice. Stay tuned for more information, which will be posted on both DAORN.org and ORNurselinks. The other HUGELY exciting news is that a periop class will be offered this fall in collaboration with AORN and Metropolitan State University. The flyer is attached. A lot of people have worked very hard to make this course a reality; the least the perioperative community can do is offer clinical sites for these students so that they can get the best possible introduction to perioperative nursing. If you would like more information, or are interested in placing a student at your facility, please contact Peggy Camp at her office at 720-279-3653. A couple of old business items: We are still looking for a host site for the March meeting. Please contact Julie Mower at juliemower@msn.com for more information or to volunteer your facility. The following committees would benefit from a few more enthusiastic volunteers to round out   their membership: Membership (Chair: Karin Underberg) Awards (Chair: Jim Stobinski) Bylaws (Acting chair: Amanda Brown) Hospital captains (Chair: Cathy Andrews) Informatics (Acting chair: Daisie Snyder) Legislative (Chair: Mickie Parsons) Scholarships/grants (Chair: Tammy Woolley)If you are interested in signing up for any of these committees, please contact Julie Mower and she will pass your information along to the respective chair. I hope everyone has a very safe and relaxing holiday weekend. For those of you working, thank you so much for providing expert assistance to those folks who need your skills and compassion the most. Julie Mower, DAORN President

item.title: August 2013 - e-missive
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
August 2013 e-missive Has this summer flown by or what!  My biggest take-away from starting my tenure as your chapter leader is that there is no such thing as taking the summer off! The board has met multiple times, both remotely and face-to-face, and has come up with some exciting new initiatives to help us achieve our chapter goals, which will be introduced in the Fall newsletter. The annual summer committee chair meeting has been expanded to include former chairs, whose wealth of information will be a welcome addition to help our new committee leaders get off to a great start.  The committee chairs will meet on Aug. 27 to review their plans for the year. I had the pleasure of attending the Leadership Academy here in Denver in July. I have to say this was one of the most informative academies I have had the pleasure of attending. Some highlights:
  • A review of the revised ORNurselink. I know that we all struggle with efficient ways to stay connected to our peers and colleagues. ORNurselink has undergone some major changes to make it more user-friendly. Check it out. And whichever website you use (DAORN or ORNurselink) make sure that your most current, correct contact information has been provided so that you don’t miss any important information related to local or national news.
  • For several years we have discussed ways to for our members to who are unable to attend in person to participate remotely. Now, AORN is providing access via Readytalk to chapters for a nominal fee. Be prepared to discuss and vote on this exciting initiative during the Sept. meeting. Remote attendees would be able to dial/log in and participate in chapter meetings. There is also the capability of attaching the speaker’s slides so that this part of the educational offering could be viewed as well.
Your time is valuable, and your leaders have recognized this by making some changes to “the way we’re always done things.” Some of these changes were recommended by our newer generations of perioperative nurses:
  • Holding the board meeting via conference call the week prior to the meeting. This will give us time to better organize information to be presented at the chapter meetings, and alleviate the “time crunch” typically experienced by board members trying to get to the meeting from work.
  • Revising the meal normally offered at the meeting to better accommodate facility cost/vendor budgets. Facilities will now have the option to offer drinks (non-alcoholic) and heavy hors d’oeuvres to help control costs.
  • Encouraging host sites to develop a “theme” for each chapter meeting. Speakers and networking opportunities will be developed around the theme. The theme for Sept. is professional development.
  • There will be no educational offering/contact hours provided at the Sept. meeting. Instead, your committee chairs and elected officers will spend a few minutes discussing their roles, responsibilities, and goals for the year. Changes to bylaws will be reviewed and voted on. The points worksheet for attending Congress as a delegate and/or running for office will be reviewed.  If you are interested in becoming more involved in AORN, or have a friend who has never attended a chapter meeting, this is a great opportunity to get an introduction to DAORN.
  Mark your calendar for these important dates and for the monthly chapter meetings as no postcards will be sent.  Check our website at daorn.wpmudev.host often to stay informed. OR Nurse Day   Saturday, Nov.9, 2013    Denver Museum of Nature and Science Fall workshop   Friday, Nov. 22, 2013 Presbyterian St. Luke’s Medical Center Schedule of meetings Sept. 12, 2013: AORN Headquarters Oct. 10, 2013:  Exempla St. Joseph’s Hospital Nov.  14, 2013: Denver Health January 9, 2014: Exempla Lutheran Medical Center February 13, 2014: Children’s Hospital Colorado March 13, 2014: TBD April 10, 2014: Swedish Medical Center May 8, 2014: St. Anthony West

item.title: Fall 2013 - President's Message
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
DAORN Fall Newsletter President’s Message DAORN promises to continue its tradition as a strong advocate for local perioperative nurses. I am proud to serve as your President for 2013-2014. This year will be one of changes, beginning with a new name for our annual national conference. No longer known as “Congress”, the new name, “Surgical Conference and Expo” more accurately defines the experience we’ve come to enjoy as the major education and industry convention for our profession. Change is taking place on the local level as well. Based on the results of the survey distributed in the spring, members confirmed that your time is valuable. A major initiative for this year is to strive for a meaningful experience for every meeting, every time. New ideas to recruit, retain, and reward members have been suggested, and I’m excited to see how they will be implemented. Look forward to participating in these new projects:
  • “Theme” related meetings to encourage networking and to showcase the host site’s special strengths and attributes
  • Monthly service projects
  • Innovative ways  to acknowledge members’ contributions to their profession and our chapter
Feel free to talk with any board member to share your ideas for improving the chapter experience, or to volunteer for one of our many initiatives. Our own mini “Expo”, the annual Fall Workshop, is undergoing some changes as well.  This year will be devoted entirely to perioperative nursing issues. Held at Presbyterian St. Luke’s on Nov. 22, the workshop promises to be an exciting day spent with nationally recognized leaders in our profession who will share their insights on a variety of topics. Our major fundraiser, The Bill Lord Memorial Golf tournament held June 3, incorporated a change in the silent auction. An auctioneer added another level of excitement to the bidding war for sports memorabilia. Both the Fall Workshop and the golf tournament rely on volunteers to ensure their continued success. If you volunteered last year, thank you. If you didn’t, it’s not too late to support these or any one of the many volunteer opportunities available throughout the year.  If you’ve never been active in DAORN before, isn’t it time for a change? I look forward to embracing the changes we’ll see this year. Let’s make a difference together.   Officers/Board/Committee chairs I’d like to take a moment to introduce your board and committee chairs for 2013-2014. Drop them an e-mail or introduce yourself at a meeting or chapter activity and take a moment to thank them for their volunteer service. DAORN Board Members President: Julie Mower President elect: Sharon Luhrs Vice President: Faith Beazer Treasurer: Tammy Woolley Secretary: Julie Martin Board members: Cathy Andrews Dee Claassen Kathy Doughty   Committee chairs Awards : Jim Stobinski Bylaws: Amanda Brown Education: Peggy Camp Fall Workshop: Julie Martin Finance: Tammy Woolley Hospital Captains: Cathy Andrews Informatics: Daisie Snyder Legislative: Mickie Parsons Membership: Karin Underberg Nominating: April Erbland OR Nurses’ Day: Sharon Luhrs Scholarships/grants: Tammy Woolley Ways and Means: Ellen Lord Website Design: Faith Beazer When you see these folks, either in the hall at your facility or at a chapter meeting, make sure you give them a shout out and let them know how much they’re appreciated. The chapter could not run without them.   Save the dates OR Nurse Day   Saturday, Nov.9, 2013    Denver Museum of Nature and Science Fall workshop   Friday, Nov. 22, 2013 Presbyterian St. Luke’s Medical Center Bill Lord Memorial Golf Tournament    Monday, June 2, 2014  The Ranch AORN Surgical Conference and Expo   March 29-April 2, 2014 Chicago IL Make sure you mark your calendar for these important dates and for the monthly chapter meetings as no postcards will be sent.  Check our website at daorn.wpmudev.host often to stay informed. Schedule of meetings Sept. 12, 2013: AORN Headquarters Oct. 10, 2013:  Exempla St. Joseph’s Hospital Nov.  14, 2013: Denver Health January 9, 2014: Exempla Lutheran Medical Center February 13, 2014: Children’s Hospital Colorado March 13, 2014: TBD April 10, 2014: Swedish Medical Center May 8, 2014: St. Anthony West   2013-2014 Goals Increase opportunities to participate in chapter meetings. Begin preparations for AORN Conference and Surgical Expo, Denver, CO, 2015. Revise scholarship/grant process to address changes in nursing programs. Explore new avenues for supporting and celebrating individual chapter members’ accomplishments. Initiate an “Adopt a cause” for monthly chapter meetings.

item.title: DAORN Bylaws Change
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded: Important news! AORN has made changes to their bylaws, some of which will affect our chapter. Please review the following documents and be prepared to discuss/vote on them  during  our Sept. meeting.   The first document is AORN's changes to the bylaws as voted on during Congress in March. Please note that Articles  II, III, and XIII are mandatory and must be included in our policy and procedure book exactly as written. They will not require a vote. The next document is one that our Bylaws chair has drafted which incorporates AORN's bylaws (as applicable) into our own policies and procedures.   Please take a moment to familiarize yourselves with these documents. Thank you! Julie Mower, President, DAORN    2013 2014 Bylaws Guidelines2 for Chapters DAORN Bylaws changes 2013

item.title: September 2013
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded: September e-missive The kids are back in school, the days are supposed to be getting cooler (it’s certainly staying dark longer), and the Rockies aren’t in the playoffs again...it must be September and time for our chapter meetings to begin. We’re starting off big, with AORN Headquarters hosting our meeting on Thursday, Sept. 12th, beginning at 1730 with picnic-style fare provided courtesy of CCI. This meeting will be spent catching up with old friends and meeting new ones. We’ll kick off with introductions of board and committee members-these are the folks who drive the DAORN bus so make it a point to say hi, let them know your ideas for making our chapter better, or just let them know they’re doing a great job. Want to be more involved? This meeting provides a great opportunity to learn about all the exciting initiatives in the works.   AORN staff will be here to answer questions about the 2014 and 2015 Surgical Expos.   We’ll also discuss and vote on changes to our bylaws. If you aren’t able to come to the meeting, you will be able to access it remotely by calling Conference Phone Number: 866.740.1260 Access Code: 3686729 and going to https://cc.readytalk.com/r/yj7cdb2ziw6f&eom  on your computer. You will then be able to participate in the meeting and view any slides. So come on down to 2170 S. Parker Road and pick up a tally sheet to keep track of your eligibility points, learn about the “Cause of the Month”, and help DAORN off to a strong start for the 2013-2014 year. I’m looking forward to seeing all of you next week. Julie Mower, DAORN President Meeting Agenda, Sept. 12, 2013 1730-1800: Dinner and networking 1800-2000: Business meeting I. Welcome Attendance/guests/ AORN staff (K. Underberg) II. Approval of May 2013 minutes (attached) III. Introductions of board A. Financial report/audit report (T. Woolley) B. Board report (S. Luhrs) 1. Tally sheet 2. Cause of the month 3. Chapter Accountability Standards IV. Introductions of committee chairs A. Jim Stobinski-Awards B. Amanda Brown-Bylaws C. Peggy Camp- Education D. Julie Martin-Fall Workshop E.  Tammy Woolley - Finance F.  Cathy Andrews- Hospital Captains G. Daisie Snyder-Informatics H. Mickie Parson-Legislative I. Karin Underberg -Membership J. April Erbland -Nominating K. Sharon Luhrs -OR Nurses’ Day L. Tammy Woolley-Scholarships/grants M. Ellen Lord-Ways and Means N. Faith Beazer-Website Design New business: I. Volunteer for Parliamentarian position I. Donation to AORN Silent auction (R.Seavey) II. First-time Expo attendee (K. Underberg) III. Collaboration with local specialty nursing organizations’ symposium (P. Camp) III. Bylaws changes (A. Brown)

item.title: October 2013 - President Message
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
DAORN
October 2013 e-missive
What a fall we’ve had! The weather has bounced back to more of what we consider “normal”. After cancelling last month’s meeting, we will meet Oct. 10 at Exempla St. Joseph’s Hospital. Free parking is available. Dinner will be served in the Russell Pavilion, located on 20<sup>th</sup> St. between Franklin and Downing on the north side of the hospital. Our meeting will start promptly at 1800 in the Ranier auditorium. No outside food/beverages are allowed in the auditorium, so please plan on arriving promptly at 1730.
The evening promises to be packed with opportunities to learn, contribute, and participate. Be prepared to:
1. Review, discuss, and approve the changes to the bylaws (plus give Amanda Brown a huge shout-out for working so hard on this).
2. Choose the first Project of the Month. Your board of directors thought it would be a good idea to extend some support to the flood victims, possibly with a donation to the Red Cross.
3. Attend the educational session presented by Dr. Mark Ammons and Dr. Will Anderson on “Trans-Catheter Aortic Valve Replacement” (TAVR). After the program, time permitting, all who are interested can take a “bunny suit” tour of the Hybrid OR where these procedures are performed. A representative from the Cath Lab will also be available to demonstrate the unique capabilities of this OR.
4. Consider attending the 2014 AORN Expo in Chicago as a delegate. Bring your completed points tally form to the meeting to expedite the process. Nominations will also be taken from the floor.
5. Sign up to either attend or volunteer at the Fall Workshop, to be held Nov. 22 at Presbyterian St. Luke’s. Flyers are available on our website, as well as at the meeting.
Since we have so much packed into our chapter/educational sessions, we will utilize dinner as a “lunch and learn” where Peggy Camp and Teresa Nino will describe an exciting new multi-specialty educational opportunity. The chapter will have a chance to recommend speakers/topics for the conference’s “Patient safety” theme.
This will be your last chance to volunteer for committees for the 2013-2014 year. There are tons of opportunities that will fit even the busiest schedule. So come on down to St. Joseph’s on Thursday-you won’t want to miss a minute of this meeting!
Julie Mower, DAORN President

item.title: October 10, 2013 - DAORN Meeting
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
October 10, 2013

Exempla St. Joseph’s Hospital

  After cancelling last month’s meeting, we will meet Oct. 10 at Exempla St. Joseph’s Hospital. Free parking is available. Dinner will be served in the Russell Pavilion, located on 20th St. between Franklin and Downing on the north side of the hospital. Our meeting will start promptly at 1800 in the Ranier auditorium. No outside food/beverages are allowed in the auditorium, so please plan on arriving promptly at 1730.  

Oct. 10, 2013 DAORN Educational Session Speakers

Exempla St. Joseph’s Hospital

1800-1900

Dr. Mark Ammons, a cardiothoracic surgeon, and Dr. Will Anderson, an interventional cardiologist, will present “Trans-Catheter Aortic Valve Replacement” (TAVR). 1.0 Contact hour (pending). This activity has been submitted to the Competency and Credentialing Institute (CCI) for approval to award 1.0 contact hour.  CCI is accredited as an approver of continuing nursing education by the CA Board of Registered Nurses, Provider number 15613. There is no attendance fee associated with this session. Activities that are approved by CCI are recognized as continuing education for registered nurses. This recognition does not imply that CCI or the CA Board of Registered Nurses approves or endorses any product included in this presentation.

item.title: October 2013 - DAORN Meeting Minutes
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
DAORN MEETING MINUTES   Date: October 10, 2013 HOST FACILITY:  St. Joseph’s   Meeting called to order by Julie Mower at 1807.   Thank you to sponsors: Julie Mower, DAORN President acknowledged Kim Ceasar and CNO Mary Shepler and St. Joseph’s Hospital for hosting the meeting.   Attendance/Guests:  Quorum established.  There were 40 members present and 3 guests introduced.   Approval of May 2013 meeting minutes- minutes approved as written.   Treasurer’s report:  **see balance sheet   General Fund:                                  $ 24,727.67 Raffle Fund:                                      $      127.70 Bill Lord Scholarship Fund:           $   3,891.75 Subtotal Current Assets:   $28,747.12 King Soopers:                                  $   5,200.00 Total Current Assets:       $33,947.12   Liabilities:  $572.31 for Fall Workshop Brochure Printing Golf Tournament Net Profit was $4,401.53   Correspondence: Condolences to the families of past members Karen Mathis and Mary Hopper.   Board Report:  Combined board meeting this summer established committee/board liaisons.  Silent auction for 2014 Surgical Expo – members approved 2 gift packages for a night out at 2015 Expo in Denver for $100 each ($200 total). Code of Conduct adopted as written (requirement for chapter accountability).  Cause of the month:  Project Cure is October’s designated charity.  Chapter is nominating Peggy Camp for national educator award this year.   Old business:
  • Fall workshop – November 22 at PSL.  Please send vendor participant names to Peggy. Need 4-6 volunteers for the registration and vendor tables.
  • Bylaws – Powerpoint and handout reviewed.  Article 2 changes are to be in alignment with national and no voting needed.  Article 3-Section 1, 3, 5 proposed changes approved as presented.  Article 5 – Section 2, 4 (also replaces section 3) approved as presented.  Article 7 – Section 1 approved as presented.
         New business:
  • First Time Congress attendees-Deferred due to time constraint.
  • Multidisciplinary workshop – February 13th at University.
  • Code of Ethics – See above.
  • Parliamentarian – Deferred due to time constraint.
    Committee Reports  (Committee chairs or designees)
  • Nominating: Can send 15 delegates this year.  Must have 12 pts (9/2012 thru 9/2013) and cannot have attended last year.  Forms received from Eileen Havey, Sandra Lindahl, Linda Ortiz, Barb Youngberg, Joan Blanchard, Ellen Lord, Sharon Luhrs and Julie Mower.
  • By Laws: Proposed bylaw changes all approved as written (above).
  • Awards – Members who have gone back to school were recognized.
  • Fall workshop, Education: See above.
  • Finance – No report (see above).
  • Legislative - Deferred due to time constraint.
  • Membership –See above.
  • Publicity – Deferred due to time constraint.
  • OR Nurse Week – November 9 Day at Museum. They requested additional dates for DAORN presentations, including career theme Oct. 20th. Future dates suggested 12/7 and 2/1/14.
  • Education Grants – Deferred due to time constraint.
  • Ways and Means – Deferred due to time constraint.
  • Research – Deferred due to time constraint.
  • Hospital Captains – Deferred due to time constraint.
  • Raffle/Historian – Several items donated tonight.
  • Informatics – Deferred due to time constraint.
  • Teller committee – See above.
    Meeting adjourned at 1902.   Respectfully submitted, Julie Martin, Secretary

  1. Valet parking is available for $5.00.

  2. There is generally parking on the first 2 levels of the Delaware Garage which is to the south of the Hospital on Delaware street. The fee for the parking garage is $2.00

Please remember to bring a canned food item to the meeting to be donated to Mt. St. Vincent’s Children’s home.

See you Thursday!

Julie Mower, DAORN President

item.title: President's Message - January 2014
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded: Happy New Year! Was anyone else totally caught off guard by the passing of 2013? A new year always gives us a great opportunity for fresh starts and trying something new. If you haven’t been a regular attendee of our monthly chapter meetings, add this to your other resolutions. We’ll be meeting at Exempla Lutheran Medical Center on Thursday, Jan. 9. Our guest speaker will be Dr. Hudson Garrett, presenting "Beyond Superficial Layers: A Review of Evidence-Based Practice for the Proper Use of Skin Antiseptics". In addition to this great educational offering, another item on the agenda will be choosing the member the chapter will fund as a first-time attendee to the Chicago Expo. And don’t forget to bring a canned good for our Cause of the Month, Mt. St. Vincent’s Children’s Home. The Periop 101 course held at Metro was a resounding success. Peggy Camp will give us an update, and there’s a flyer on our website with more information for the next class. A quality preceptor has been shown to be the single most important orientation tool. This is a great opportunity to step up and offer your expertise to our next generation of perioperative nurses. Plan now to attend the inaugural Interdisciplinary Collaboration for the Improvement of Patient Outcomes, to be held Thursday, Feb. 13 from 0700-1500 at the Anschutz Inpatient Pavilion. There’s a flyer on our website with registration information. The nice part about this location is that you only have to park once: you can walk next door for the Feb. DAORN meeting at Children’s. Teresa Nino and the local chapter of the American Association of Critical Care Nurses reached out to DAORN at the inception of this project; it would be great for the perioperative community to support them. It’s not too late to think about running for a chapter office for 2014-2015. Talk with any of your officers or board members, and make sure the nominating committee has your contact information and your willingness to serve form. Sign-up sheets will be passed around beginning next week. In addition to your resolutions to get more rest and drink more water, don’t forget to be kind to yourself by enhancing your professional development as an active DAORN member. I’m looking forward to seeing all of you next week. Julie Mower DAORN President

item.title: Presidents Message - February 2014
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
Unless you’ve been vacationing on Mars the last several months, it would be difficult to ignore the fact that Denver has a pretty good football team this year. I’m not a football fan, but I do like to watch Peyton Manning. He’s passionate about his job and he’s good at it, two attributes I admire in anyone, regardless of profession. It’s no secret that Peyton is something of a surgical miracle. After 4 operations on his neck, he’s lucky to be able to raise his arms, let alone throw touchdown passes. Every time he’s sacked and his head bounces off the ground, I hold my breath until he gets back up. Certainly Mr. Manning’s surgeons should take due credit for his successful return to a game he loves to play. However, I believe a core group of dedicated health care providers has been overlooked in his return. I have yet to meet a surgeon who worked alone; somewhere, there is a group of OR nurses who share in this highly visible positive patient outcome.   I’ll bet they’ll be cheering for him on Sunday. Just don’t forget to breathe. February, although a month short on days, is long on DAORN activities. I hope to see you at one or more of the following:
  • OR Nurses at the Museum of Nature and Science, Feb. 1, 1000-1500. Contact Sharon Luhrs at luhrsams@netzero.com for more information or to volunteer.
  • Interdisciplinary Collaboration for the Improvement of Patient Outcomes, Feb. 13, 0700-1700, Anschutz Pavilion 2, University of CO Hospital. $75, 6.5 CH’s, lunch included. Go to http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?llr=5q6upyeab&oeidk=a07e8joxoxe10964b6d to register.
  • DAORN meeting, The Children’s Hospital, Feb. 13. Dinner at 1730, business meeting 1800-1845, educational session, 1900-2000: Dr. Brent O’Neil, Stereotactic Laser Ablation Therapy in Neurosurgery.
Our members continue to offer their time and expertise to community volunteer opportunities. Thank you for all who brought donations for Mt. St. Vincent’s Children’s Center. This month the center is asking for donations of school and art supplies. Visit their website at http://www.msvhome.org/help-abused-children/wish-list.html for a list of suggested donation items; there will be a box to collect them at our meeting. Next month’s meeting will be held at Project Cure. If possible, come at 1600 and share your perioperative expertise. Stay for dinner and a presentation on mission work by our own Faith Beazer. Volunteers will earn an extra point towards meeting eligibility criteria to serve as a delegate. Last but not least...if you would like to hone your leadership skills, there are several openings. More information will be available at the chapter meeting. See you Feb. 13th!  Julie Mower, DAORN President

OFFICE

TERM

NUMBER OF OPEN POSITIONS
President-elect 2014-2015; will serve as President 2015-2016 1
Vice President 2014-2016 1
Secretary 2014-2016 1
Board of Directors 2014-2016 2
Nominating Committee 2014-2016 3

item.title: President's Message - March 2014
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
President’s message
March 2014
A “heart”felt thank-you to Children’s Hospital and Tammy Woolley for hosting our February meeting. Our speaker, Dr. Brent O’Neill, provided a fascinating discussion on stereotactic surgery for epilepsy.
Speaking of education-get ready to add another conference to your calendar for next year. Sharon Luhrs and Peggy Camp represented DAORN in launching the first-ever multidisciplinary workshop, which included 6 area specialty nursing organizations. The speakers were outstanding, and several other nursing organizations have expressed a desire to be included in next year’s venue.
A huge thank you for all who brought school supplies for Mt. St. Vincent’s Children’s Home. Donations will again be collected at the March meeting.
Our own Peggy Camp has been awarded the AORN Outstanding Educator of the Year. If you are attending the Surgical Conference/Expo, please try and attend the awards ceremony-I know she would like to see some familiar smiling faces in the audience. Peggy would not have received this well-deserved award without the behind-the-scenes work of the Awards Committee, so kudos to them as well.
Our next DAORN meeting will be March 13<sup>th</sup> at Project Cure. The warehouse may be chilly, so dress accordingly. If your schedule allows, plan on arriving at 1600 for an hour and a half of volunteer service. Be prepared to enjoy a presentation by Faith Beazer as she takes us on a tour of one of her mission trips. I’m fairly certain she will be taking us someplace warm!
One of our last major tasks as a chapter this year is to choose our leaders for 2014-2015. I would love to see the ballot chock-full of names. The available positions are listed below; I’ve included the “job descriptions” as attachments. There are varying levels of time commitments and eligibility requirements, but I’m confident there’s a spot for anyone who is looking for an opportunity to hone those leadership skills. If you are interested in running for office, please contact April Erbland, Nominating Committee chair, at aerbland@comcast.net for more information. You will need to submit a willingness to serve form and a biographical sheet (available on our website at daorn.org).There are also plenty of committee spots available for next year as well; look for those sign-up sheets during the April meeting.
Open positions for DAORN chapter, 2014-2015:
President-Elect (serves as president 2015-2016)
Vice President (two year term; 2014-2016)
Secretary (two year term; 2014-2016)
Board of directors: need two people to serve, 2014-2016
Nominating committee: need three people to serve, 2014-2016. Also need a current member to serve as chair for next year.
I’m looking forward to seeing all of you at the March meeting. Stay warm until then! Julie Mower, DAORN President

Outstanding Assets:  One returned check from Molnycke $232.50 for missing account information, and check from 2 members for Congress registration - $1,050 deposited.   Correspondence: Julie Mower requested the members keep Marge Utz and her family in your thoughts and prayers.   Board Report:  Sharon Luhrs reported that the combined nursing conference today at University was well attended.  She also distributed sign-up sheets for members attending 2014 Expo, and encouraged DAORN members to check the journal to review information on national candidates.  The March chapter meeting is at Project Cure and you are encouraged to dress warm!   Old business:    Julie Mower is checking into whether the chapter can trial ReadyTalk for one month, and will report back at the March meeting.   Committee Reports:  (Committee chairs or designees)  
  • Awards – Julie Mower reported that AORN will take chapter picture Sunday at 0630 during the 2014 Expo.  Chapter award nomination was submitted.
  • Fall workshop: Julie Martin reported that she will gather information on date and location for next year’s conference.  The committee recommends that we pay for the conference center to avoid the audio-visual issues. The chapter can financially support paying for the venue.
  • Finance –Report above.
  • Ways and Means – Dee Claassen reported that the chapter will sell potato bags again this year at the 2014 Expo.  The annual golf tournament is Monday, June 2nd.
  • Nominating Committee – There are chapter officer positions open, which will be posted on chapter website. If interested, see April Erbland or a committee member.
  • Legislation – The chapter website is up to date and updates occur on Fridays.
  • Parliamentarian – Sandy Lindahl volunteered for 2014.
  • Education – No applicants this month.  Tammy verified that you cannot apply on line but must submit a form to the committee.
  • Raffle/Historian:  Valentine’s Day items were donated for this month.
    Old business: 
  • Amanda Brown announced that she was appointed to the national AORN scholarship committee.
  • Mary Jo Steiert reported that the new Vail area chapter for AORN has 62 current members and is having a seminar on June 21st (Bill Duffy and Sharon McNamara are speaking).  Also, April 5th is the Pink Vail event to benefit Shaw Valley (breast cancer awareness event).

  Meeting adjourned at 1843.   Respectfully submitted, Julie Martin, Secretary

item.title: President's Message - May 2014
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
President’s Message May 2014
It is with mixed emotions that I write my last President’s Message. On one hand I will be sorry to retire my office; I’ve truly enjoyed every minute. But I’m equally excited to see the new directions and initiatives our new President, Sharon Luhrs, and her board and committees will take us in 2014/2015. Please support her as you have me.
A HUGE thank-you to Swedish Medical Center for hosting the April chapter meeting. Attendees enjoyed another stellar speaker; Dr. Kurian provided an excellent update on surgical treatments for GERD. As a more “seasoned” nurse, I continue to be amazed at the changes in technology that were unheard of 30 years ago.
The last time for anything deserves a moment of reflection, and I’ll like to take a look at our goals for 2013/2014 and progress made towards meeting them:
1. Increase opportunities to participate in chapter meetings
Daisie Snyder has stepped into the new role of chair of the Information Technology committee and embraced the challenges. Under her direction, DAORN was able to trial remote access to members through Readytalk. This is still a work in progress but holds great promise as an added benefit for our members.
Besides being posted on the DAORN website, President’s messages were also posted on ORNurselink, expanding the audience who received chapter news.
2. Begin preparations for AORN Conference and Expo, Denver, CO, 2015
Our own Peggy Camp has been selected as part of the national planning committee. I’m sure there will be plenty of volunteer opportunities at all levels. Take a minute to let her or Sharon know of your willingness to serve.
3. Revise scholarship/grant process to address changes in nursing programs
The way the board reviews and selects candidates for scholarships will take into account the changing face of nursing education.
4. Explore new avenues for supporting and celebrating individual chapter members’ accomplishments
In addition to winning the AORN top award for chapter achievement, Peggy Camp was nominated and awarded the Perioperative Excellence in Education award. For the first time, a first-time attendee was funded at delegate status to attend Surgical Conference.
5. Initiate “Adopt a Cause” for monthly chapter meetings
$90 worth of school supplies were donated to Mt. St. Vincent’s Children’s Home, a treatment center for children with severe emotional and behavioral problems. In addition, our March chapter meeting was combined with an opportunity to donate time at Project Cure.
This is a great time to thank my board and amazing committee chairs and members. Space will not allow me to name everyone here, but plan on attending our May meeting at St. Anthony West. Dinner will be served at 1730, with awards to follow. Please join me as we welcome our new leaders and thank the ones who have donated so much of their time and expertise to making our chapter “Denver Strong”!
And speaking of volunteers-please make sure to lend your enthusiasm, energy, and expertise to the Bill Lord Memorial Golf Tournament, held June 2 at everyone’s favorite golf course at the Ranch. Please see Ellen Lord for volunteering opportunities.
Julie Mower, DAORN President, 2013-2014

Date: May 8, 2014

 HOST FACILITY:  St. Anthony’s Hospital

Meeting called to order by Julie Mower at 1800.   Thank you to sponsors: Julie Mower, DAORN President acknowledged Storz for providing dinner, and Cathy Andrews and the St. Anthony’s leadership for hosting the meeting.   Attendance/Guests:  Quorum established with 32 members present. There were 6 guests present.   Approval of April 2014 meeting minutes- minutes approved as written.   Treasurer’s report:  **see balance sheet   General Fund:                                 $ 21,752.10 Raffle Fund:                                     $      128.70 Bill Lord Scholarship Fund:          $  6,252.85 Subtotal Current Assets:   $28,133.65 King Soopers:                                  $   4,700.00 Total Current Assets:       $32,833.65   Correspondence: Julie Mower relayed that there is a card to sign for Marge Utz. There was also a thank you note from Susie Obert for the AORN Foundation donation of $200.   Board Report: Sharon Luhrs provided an Expo update with 12 delegates and one first-time attendee.   Old business:  Julie Mower relayed that the sign up sheets for committees and meeting host sites are being circulated.   Committee Reports:  (Committee chairs or designees)  
  • Nominating- committee members were acknowledged and ballot results will be presented later in the agenda.
  • Membership –Karin Underberg announced 14 perfect meeting attendance awards.
  • Ways and Means – Ellen Lord recognized the many volunteers at the chapter booth at Expo with a profit of $1,554.17. The annual golf tournament is Monday, June 2nd and Ellen requested items for the gift bags and cases of water to be donated. The board approved $1,000 for all four applicants for the Bill Lord scholarship – three of which were sponsored by DAORN members. The awardees are Carly Baker, Andine Gilmore, Trisha Murray and Diana Shpitalnik.
  • Legislation – Mickie Parsons provided an update on the current bills in the legislative process, including the governor signing the breast/cervical cancer bill and the student immunization mandate which was withdrawn. There is more information on the Colorado website under legislative update.
  • Bylaws – Amanda reported that there is a parliamentarian, and the committee updated the bylaws which were converted to CDs versus the binders for the board members.
  • Awards – Powerpoint was viewed prior to the chapter meeting, including the pictures from winning the chapter award.
  • Education/Grants – Susan Younger received a scholarship for the DAORN Fall Workshop. Goal for next year is to have more applications submitted.
  • Informatics - Daisy Snyder was acknowledged for the pilot of ReadyTalk and Faith Beazer for the website.
  • Fall Workshop – Julie Martin recognized the committee members and provided highlights from the annual report including 82 attendees and 38 vendors for a net profit of $15,402.24, and the success of using the credit card cube to process payments.
  • OR Nurse Week – Sharon relayed the success of the three dates at the museum, and plans for three in the upcoming year.
  • Raffle/Historian: Next raffle will be at Golf tournament and there was a call for silent auction gift donations for the golf tournament.
  New Business: Julie Mower reported the election results with 54 ballots received and 3 ineligible. Motion made and moved to destroy the ballots. Julie Mower performed the induction of new officers including President-Elect: Faith Beazer, Vice-President: Karin Underberg, Secretary: Jane Fulton-Junge, Board Members: Lesia Hatlestad and Julie Martin, and Nominating Committee: Ellen Lord, Sandy Lindahl and Eileen Fraser. Outgoing board members were recognized as well, including Julie Mower who will be Past President. Gavel was officially handed over to incoming President Sharon Luhrs.   Meeting adjourned at 1903.   Respectfully submitted, Julie Martin, Secretary

Our chapter has $100 King Soopers gift cards for sale at each chapter meeting until all those on hand are sold. The sale of KSC is being discontinued because there is a lack of participation in this Ways and Means project.
Because the streets in Lakewood were flooding when three of us attempted to drive to our chapter meeting on October 09, 2014, the "Early Christmas Shoppers" Raffle was not held that night. item.title: Meeting Minutes - October 2014
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
DAORN MEETING MINUTES

Date: October 9, 2014

HOST FACILITY:  Children’s Hospital

Meeting called to order by Sharon Luhrs at 1809. Meal provided by John from Medline. Attendance/Guests:  Quorum established with 33 members present. There were 3 visitors. Approval of September 2014 meeting minutes- minutes approved as written. Treasurer’s report:  As of October 9, 2014 General Fund:                                    $ 30,070.40 Subtotal Current Assets:          $32,897.35

King Soopers:                          $   N/A

            Total Current Assets:  $32,897.35   Correspondence: None new   Board Report: Sharon Luhrs President, reviewed the projects and chapter goals for this year. The process for getting more committee membership was addressed. New Board Members were introduced as well as committee chairs and designees. Old business:  Ready Talk was available. Discussion on the cost. AORN national committee is asking us to be more involved as a chapter. What does that look like? Donations to the project in honor of Virginia Rogge. Monetary contribution from chapter. Next month (November) the board members will start collecting money in the form of cash or checks. The chapter will send money two or three times throughout the year. The chapter will also match the funds. OR Nurses Day at the museum. Three events. September, Schools that participated were from the Denver Urban Group. Next event will be October 11th. Need gowns, gloves, bear hugger, and will also be teaching hand hygiene. Sign-up sheets available before you leave tonight. There were 22 Perioperative 101 students that were sponsored to the fall workshop! Committee Reports:  (Committee chairs or designees)
  • Nominating- Chair needed. There are 3 people signed up for the committee. Need to know who will take over as chair. Sharon will contact the three members to see who will lead the committee. Will have name at next meeting. Julie Mower will help to get nominations for delegates underway. Points sheet is up to date on website.
  • Awards – Chair: Mary Jo Steiert. David Wyatt awarded for Performance Excellence. Congratulations!!!     Next Year: Awards Committee from National Headquarters will be selecting for
  • Honor A Nurse for Outstanding Achievement in Mentorship in Perioperative Clinical Nursing Practice;
  • Clinical Education
  • Academic Education
  • Perioperative Managers
  • Volunteer Membership
  • Public Advocacy
Awards committee needs nominations by November 3, 2014 Also need nominations for DAORN chapter awards to the Awards Committee.
  • Membership – Chair: Matti Bacca. Request made of this committee to create a Member Directory. Continued discussion on this directory. Lots of issues to work out along the lines of privacy etc.
  • Ways and Means – Chair: Ellen Lord. No Report
  • AORN Volunteer Expo -- Chair: Peggy Camp. Suzanne Sortman & Rachael Hall and Peggy are planning for the EXPO. Please notify Suzanne if you can help.
  • Legislation – Chair: Micki Parsons. Day at the Capitol, January 6th and 7th, 2015.
  • Bylaws – Chair: Amanda Brown. Amanda is willing to remain the committee chair, but she needs members help.
  • Education – Chair: Peggy Camp. Will be handing out a needs assessment for education sessions at meetings for the coming year. Education for tonight: Webinars in OR Manager, 2X month for 1 hour. Next one OCT 30th. At 1500. Subject Affordable Care Act and how Hospitals Cope.
  • Education Grants – No Chair. No Report
  • Informatics – Chair: Faith Beazer. No Report.
  • Fall Workshop – Chair: Julie Martin October 17th at the Lowry Conference Center. 25 Vendors. Secured Lunch Boxes. Will have 150.
  • OR Nurse Week – Sharon relayed the success of the three dates at the museum, and plans for three in the upcoming year. Shiela needs OR supplies donated.
  • Raffle/Historian – Chair Geri. October and November meetings, please bring in AORN historical items for display. No King Soopers or raffles tonight.
  • AORN Foundation: For EXPO: Silent Auction will run Saturday, Sunday, Monday. Donations of items. Package to bid on, Trip to London in May to the Nightingale Celebration in Westminster Abby. Chapter normally donates 500$ to Foundation—Motion to donate Passed. Closing Statement at EXPO will be made by Vivian Watson AORN Ombudsman. She turns 80 next May, she has written a book.
  • Hospital Captains- Chair: Cathy Andrews. No Report.
  • OR Nurses’ Day Chair – Chair: Sharon Luhrs. Good turnout last year. Invited to set up four short demos for 6th-9th September 20,2014. Other dates to be discussed.
  • Research – Chair: Sheila Listen. May be interested in staying chair. Need additional members. Suggestions for subjects: EBOLA, Intra-Operative Radiation Therapy.
  • Teller – Chair: Need Chair. No Report.
  • New Business: Should we do something fun as a group to treat ourselves on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon? Bring suggestions to November Meeting.
  November meeting changed to Swedish Hospital. April meeting changed to St. Anthony Hospital. Meeting adjourned at 6:37 pm. . Respectfully submitted by Jane Fulton-Junge Secretary DAORN

item.title: Surgical Conference & Expo Volunteer
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
Surgical Conference & Expo Volunteer

ATTENTION DAORN MEMBERS - it is not too late to Volunteer to help wight he 2015 Surgical Conference and EXPO
 There are many opportunities to be involved throughout the week and your help is appreciated. Please review the important information:
1. The Volunteer kickoff meeting is Saturday, March 7th at 10AM in Room 103. The photographer will be taking shots of the volunteers (to be shown at opening ceremony.) I will have scarves for all of the Denver Volunteers to wear for the photos —if you want to purchase to wear so attendees can identify you as local chapter volunteers, the price is $16.25 plus tax (probably under $18.00). The scarves are a light green bamboo knit fabric with an etched Congress logo. The scarves will also be on sale throughout the week at the DAORN booth. Following the photo shoot will be a brief orientation on the volunteer”to-do’s" for the week.
2. There is still a need for Moderators and Session Assistants —please signup on line at  https://www.aorn.org/surgicalexpo/volunteer/  or check with Speaker Prep Room on site.
3. We will have (especially on Saturday, Sunday and Monday) a need for volunteers to help greet and direct attendees to sessions, restrooms, special events etc —please consider this assignment as the Convention center can be confusing for both new and seasoned attendees. If you are interested in doing this, please familiarize yourself with the center after you have completed your registration!!
4. As in the past DAORN will be hosting a table in the Volunteer area. This is one of the chapter’s main fund raising events and we can use all of your help. There will be  a sign-up sheet at the booth, so please come by and help to staff table - booth will be closed during education sessions.
Thank you for your help.
Questions, please feel free to contact Suzanne Sortman, Rachel Hall or myself. (Expo Volunteer Coordinators)
Peggy Camp

item.title: Meeting Minutes - January 2015
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
DAORN CHAPTER MEETING MINUTES Meeting call-in # 1-866-740-1260 & Access code: 5177749 Thursday January 8, 2015 1800-1900 Meeting called to order at 1805 by Chapter President Sharon Luhrs Meal provided by Covidien. Membership: Quorum reached. Attendance 27 plus 3 visitors, plus 3 on the phone. Treasurer’s report:  As of December 1, 2014 ASSETS Checking/Savings Accounts: General Account $41,360.43 Raffle               $     303.70 Bill Lord             $   2,522.85 TOTAL ASSETS  $44,186.98 KS Certificates               $0
  • January bank statements were not available as of 1/4/15. Still waiting on some bills from the Fall Workshop. Will have report on costs and profits at February Meeting.
  • There are no more King Soopers certificates. They will be removed from the budget. A big Thank you to Geri for taking care of this project through the years!
Old Minutes:
  • September Chapter Minutes: Approved with the following changes. The Periop101 students were from HCA not Metropolitan University.
  • October Chapter Minutes: Approved.
Committee Reports:
  • 2015 Congress and Expo; Volunteers, Liaisons and Greeters: Peggy Camp, Rachael, Suzanne. Periop 101 Students and 1st time attendees will help man the booth. They need more volunteers.
  • Delegates:
  • Delegate Candidates for Expo Allowance
    • Board agreement on costs. Delegate candidates need to apply for additional funds if they want to have more of the costs paid for. Each delegate will receive $535.00 for Registration, $100.00 for meals and $100.00 for parking. If they wish to stay in a hotel downtown, application must be made for an additional $200.00 and if they live more than 75 miles away. Since parking is included in the hotel fee, the sum above registration that a delegate could potentially receive would be, $400.00 for meals and hotel costs based on double occupancy and distance from congress location (75 miles or more).
  • Delegates will meet immediately after February Chapter meeting at Lutheran. This will be the last meeting before Expo.
  • 1st Time Attendee Approved Candidates for sponsored Expo Registration approved by chapter for 4 attendees ($535.00 x 5=$2675.00). Attendees to volunteer @ Surgical Expo (@ DAORN booth etc.) Attendees-Joy Freimann, Michelle Flores, Rachel Fluckey & Alexia Schuller-Peterson.
    • Ground Rules for First Time attendees:
    • Must be AORN and Chapter members
    • Must contribute time to volunteer activities of chapter and at Expo/Congress booth.
    • Must write a report and power point to present, of their experience as first time attendees to Congress and present it to the chapter meeting following Expo.
 
  • Fund Raising:
Ellen Lord brought in scarf for members to see and vote on. Sample is in purple. There are many color options available. 1st choice is teal. Will have logo and the date of Expo. Chapter will sell for $25.00 each. Cost is $15-$16. This will include 7.62% sales tax added per unit and a profit for chapter fund raising. The table (booth) will be located on the main concourse. It is Table #1. There are a total of nine chapters or state councils that have booths this year. We will be using the “Square” for credit card charges. Additional items that will be sold are the pins, assorted jewelry, potato bags.
  • Golf Tournament is scheduled for June 8th at The Ranch. Ellen Lord and Cathy Andrews to work with hospital captains to have a hospital challenge at the golf tournament.
  • Informatics: Remember that members can vote online even if they are not delegates.
  • Awards: No Report
  • Legislative: Several house bills related to healthcare.
HB#1029-Telemedicine HB#1036 Medical Marijuana Harm HB# Donated medical supplies SB# 014- Medical Marijuana, Primary Care Physicians, Edibles regulations. SB# 015- Autism
  • Education:
    • 1 Application for Grant for cost of Expo/Congress
    • Interdisciplinary Conference at Univ. of Colo. At Anschutz on February 19th. Professionals share their experiences and what they do and why. More info on the DAORN website.
  • Nurse’s Day Committee: February 28th (Sunday). Last time for Day at the Museum.
  • Announcements:
    • Nursing students interested in going into Periop/Surgery after graduation, may attend Congress for free. They only need their student ID and badge to get into Expo.
    • There is a CNOR prep class at St. Joe’s Hospital in March. Contact Mullins@sclhs.net or Tara.Rowe@schls.net
  Meeting adjourned at 1855. Minutes submitted by Jane Fulton-Junge Chapter Secretary√

Gerry Hopkins, Games Manager
 
Attention: DAORN Members and Friends:
Your help with a gift for the Silent Auction at the Golf Tournament on June 8, 2015, will be greatly appreciated. Examples of gifts needed are bottles of wine, baskets of chocolates, gourmet food, summer fun items, baby gift items, or you name it. We can use gift cards to your favorite place to shop such as Walmart, Target, Starbucks or your favorite restaurants. Please bring your items to our chapter meeting in April or May or to the Golf Tournament on June 8, 2015.
Gerry Hopkins, Ways and Means

item.title: Fall 2015-2016 President's Message
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
President’s Message I am proud to serve as your DAORN President for the 2015- 2016. As we start this year, I find myself reflecting on why I became and continue to be a perioperative nurse and member of DAORN, and I hope you do as well. As a chapter, we look forward to continuing to advocate for local perioperative nurses and the safety of patients that we care for. In order to better fit the needs of Chapter Members, we will begin offering a couple of Saturday morning meetings, instead of the traditional Thursday meeting. Hopefully this will allow members who work late during the week to attend. We also recognize that the educational speakers have taken time out of their day to join us, so this year we will have the education session before the business meeting on the Thursday evening meetings.  Additionally, as members your time is valuable so we will strive to keep the business meeting meaningful and on time. As a DAORN member the best way you can help improve the chapter is by getting involved. There are several committees and events to choose from, so be sure to sign up at the September meeting if you have not already.  The DAORN chapter is like all things in life- the more you give of yourself, the more you receive from the experiences. Each year the Fall Workshop and DAORN/Bill Lord golf tournament rely on volunteers to ensure their continued success. The money raised by these events supports the continued education of members, sending chapter delegates to Expo and nursing scholarships for students.  None of this is possible without your continued support.  If you have volunteered in the past you understand how much is involved and we thank you for your help.  If you have not volunteered, we would love to have you join us in such events! Save the date for the DAORN annual Fall Workshop on October 30th at the Lowry Event Center. The workshop promises to be an exciting day spent with nationally recognized speakers.  Attending the workshop is a great educational opportunity to renew your spirit as a perioperative nurse.  Look for the brochure on the DAORN website in September. The DAORN/Bill Lord Memorial Golf tournament held in June 2016. Please let Ellen Lord know if you are interested in volunteering.  Check the DAORN website for updated information. Save the Dates: Fall workshop   Friday, Oct. 30, 2015 Lowry Event Center Bill Lord Memorial Golf Tournament - June 2016 -The Ranch Country Club AORN Surgical Conference & Expo: April 2-6, 2016 Anaheim, CA OR Executive Summit™: April 3-6, 2016 Leadership Development Summit™: April 3-6, 2016 Make sure you mark your calendar for these important dates and for the monthly chapter meetings as no postcards will be sent.  Check our website at daorn.wpmudev.host often to stay informed.   Schedule of meetings:   Thursday – September 13, 2015 North Suburban Medical Center   Thursday – October 8, 2015 St. Anthony’s Hospital   Saturday – November 14, 2015 Children’s Hospital Colorado   Thursday – January 14, 2016 Parker Adventist   Saturday – February 6, 2016 Lutheran Hospital   Thursday – April 14, 2016 University of Colorado Hospital   Thursday – May 12, 2016 Swedish Medical Center    ***September, October, January, April and May  (2nd Thursday of the month)
  • 5:45  pm        Dinner & Networking
  • 6:00-7:00     Education Session
  • 7:05-7:35       Business Meeting
***November 14, 2015 and February 6, 2016 (Saturday)
  • 8:15  am         Breakfast
  • 8:30-9:00     Business Meeting
  • 9:05-10:05      Education Session

item.title: President's Message - September 2015
item.dc:creator: faithbeazer
item.content:encoded:
It is hard to for me to believe that it is already September, the summer has flown by for me and probably for you as well.  I am really very excited to be the DAORN Chapter President for the up coming year. Our first meeting will be Thursday September 10th at North Suburban, social hour and dinner starts at 5:45 pm.  It will be nice to catch up with old friends and meet new ones, so please take a moment to introduce yourself to those you do not know. We are changing things up for the 2015-2016 year and offering a couple of Saturday meetings to allow members who work late during the week to attend, see attached schedule or visit our website for chapter meeting dates and locations. Join us for the DAORN Fall Workshop at the Lowry Event Center on October 30th . The workshop promises to be an great educational opportunity and we are very excited to have David Wyatt as our Keynote Speaker. Attending the workshop will renew your spirit as a perioperative nurse.  Look for the brochure on the DAORN website in September. I’m looking forward to seeing all of you next week. Faith Beazer, DAORN President   Meeting Agenda, Sept. 10, 2015 1745-1800: Dinner and networking 1800-1900: Education Session 1905-1935:  Business Meeting
